title: Version 5.0.0 ERC721.safeTransferFrom trying to override non-virtual function.
body:
<!-- Briefly describe the issue you're experiencing. Tell us what you were trying to do and what happened instead. -->
So I have updated @Openzeppelin/contracts from v4.x to the latest v.5.0.0, and when I compile the contracts using `forge build`, I got this error

```bash
Error (4334): Trying to override non-virtual function. Did you forget to add "virtual"?
   --> node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/ERC721.sol:152:5:
    |
152 |     function safeTransferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 tokenId) public {
    |     ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).
Note: Overriding function is here:
   --> test/foundry/mocks/hts-precompile/HederaNonFungibleToken.sol:141:5:
```

The overriding function at `test/foundry/mocks/hts-precompile/HederaNonFungibleToken.sol:141:5:` is
```solidity
function safeTransferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 tokenId) public override {
    address sender = msg.sender;
    int64 responseCode = HtsPrecompile.preTransfer(sender, from, to, tokenId);
    if (responseCode != HederaResponseCodes.SUCCESS) {
        revert HtsPrecompileError(responseCode);
    }
    return super.safeTransferFrom(from, to, tokenId);
}
```

So as in the error log, here at [this line](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/v5.0.0/contracts/token/ERC721/ERC721.sol#L152), it's missing the `virtual`. I was checking around the release note and the PR in which the `virtual` keyword got removed but couldn't find much information. 

Is this a bug or am I using it incorrectly?

**üíª Environment**

<!-- Tell us what version of OpenZeppelin Contracts you're using, and how you're using it: Truffle, Remix, etc. -->
@Openzeppline/contracts @ v5.0.0
Foundry

**üìù Details**

<!-- Describe the problem you have been experiencing in more detail. Include as much information as you think is relevant. Keep in mind that transactions can fail for many reasons; context is key here. -->

**üî¢ Code to reproduce bug**

<!-- We will be able to better help if you provide a minimal example that triggers the bug. -->

Hey @quiet-node, you should check out the [other safeTransferFrom function](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/3e6c86392c97fbc30d3d20a378a6f58beba08eba/contracts/token/ERC721/ERC721.sol#L159). We decided to only allow overriding one of them because both rely on the same implementation.
